thread.title: How Carly Fiorina's HP record compares to other HP CEOs
thread.title_full: How Carly Fiorina's HP record compares to other HP CEOs

title: How Carly Fiorina's HP record compares to other HP CEOs
text:
Hewlett-Packard (Photo: USA TODAY)
1 CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN — Presidential candidate and former Hewlett-Packard CEO Carly Fiorina has been criticized for HP's performance during her tenure. This is how the company fared under the leadership of Fiorina and others:
Some of HP's leanest years were in the immediate aftermath of the dot-com bust, under Fiorina's helm. But by far the biggest hit was following the Autonomy acquisition engineered by Leo Apotheker, which resulted in a $12 billion loss in 2012.
Deal after deal — to the tune of $61.2 billion on eight big acquisitions since 1997 — goosed revenue and employee ranks.
Despite some major cuts and even one major spinoff (Agilent) employee ranks swelled, peaking in 2011.
Fiorina gets grief for doubling down on PCs by buying Compaq in the waning years of that business. But EDS and Autonomy resulted in big writedowns. And remember Palm?
Contributing: Eli Blumenthal in New York.
